[She]79-dodo had a certain pride in having given birth to [the son and heir of [one of [the largest English properties]2449-the largest english properties]2448-one of the largest english properties]2447-the son and heir of one of the largest english properties , and [she]79-dodo was extremely glad to have done so , and felt a certain pleased sort of proprietorship in the little pink morsel , but [she]79-dodo certainly had experienced none of the absorbing pleasures of maternity . [She]79-dodo had got used to not being in love with [[her]79-dodo husband]387-her husband , and [she]79-dodo accepted as part of this same deficiency the absence of absorbing pleasure in [the baby]283-the baby . Not that [she]79-dodo considered it a deficiency , it was merely another type turned out of [Nature]108-nature 's workshop . [Dodo]79-dodo laid all the blame on [Nature]108-nature . [She]79-dodo shrugged [her]79-dodo shoulders and said : "[792-you] [You]792-you made [me]0-i so without consulting [me]0-i . It is n't [my]0-i fault ! " But [Dodo]79-dodo was aware that [Nature]108-nature had given [her]79-dodo a brain , and [she]79-dodo found a very decided pleasure in the company of [clever people]2452-clever people . Perhaps it was the greatest pleasure of [her]79-dodo life to be admired and amused by [clever people]2452-clever people . Of course [Chesterford]80-chesterford always admired [her]79-dodo , but [he]80-chesterford was in love with [her]79-dodo , and [he]80-chesterford was not clever . [Dodo]79-dodo had felt some difficulty before [her]79-dodo marriage in dealing with this perplexing unknown quantity , and [she]79-dodo had to confess it puzzled [her]79-dodo still . The result was , that when it occurred , [she]79-dodo had to admit [her]79-dodo inability to tackle it , and as soon as possible to turn to another page in this algebra of life . But [she]79-dodo still felt that [her]79-dodo marriage had been a great success . [Chesterford]80-chesterford had entirely fulfilled what [she]79-dodo expected of [him]80-chesterford : [he]80-chesterford was immensely rich , [he]80-chesterford let [her]79-dodo do as [she]79-dodo liked , [he]80-chesterford adored [her]79-dodo . [Dodo]79-dodo quite felt that it was better that [he]80-chesterford should adore [her]79-dodo . As long as that lasted , [he]80-chesterford would be blind to any fault of [hers]79-dodo , and [she]79-dodo acknowledged that , to [a man of [Chesterford]80-chesterford 's character]2454-a man of chesterford 's character , [she]79-dodo must seem far from faultless , if [he]80-chesterford contemplated [her]79-dodo calmly . But [he]80-chesterford was quite unable to contemplate [her]79-dodo calmly . For [him]80-chesterford [she]79-dodo walked in a golden cloud that dazzled and entranced [him]80-chesterford . "[800-that woman in the moated grange] For instance , [that woman in [the moated Grange]801-the moated grange]800-that woman in the moated grange ought to have swept away the blue fly that buzzed in the pane , and set a mouse - trap for the mouse that shrieked , and got [the carpenter to repair the mouldering wainscot]802-the carpenter to repair the mouldering wainscot , and written to the Psychical Research , how [she]800-that woman in the moated grange had heard [her]800-that woman in the moated grange own sad name in corners cried , and it could n't have been the cat , or [she]800-that woman in the moated grange would have caught the shrieking mouse . The questions about which [a man]279-a man is apt to , say that [he]279-a man alone can judge , are usually exactly those questions in which [his]279-a man judgment is most likely to be at fault , for they concern [him]279-a man very intimately ‚Äî a truth which [he]279-a man expresses by saying that [he]279-a man alone can judge about them , and for that very reason [his]279-a man emotions are apt to colour what [he]279-a man considers [his]279-a man sober decision . [Jack]78-jack was exactly in this position when [he]78-jack left [the Chesterfords]135-the chesterfords ' door that afternoon . It was only six o'clock when [he]78-jack went away , and [he]78-jack wished to be alone , and to think about it . But [the house]2114-the house seemed stuffy and unsuggestive , and [he]78-jack ordered a horse , and sat fuming and frowning till it came round . This was sufficient to show that [he]78-jack was in a perturbed frame of mind . [The Row]249-the row was rather empty , for a great race meeting was going on , and [Jack]78-jack cantered quickly up to the end , and cursed [his]78-jack stupidity for not having gone to [Sandown]222-sandown . Then [he]78-jack put [his]78-jack horse to a quiet pace , and determined to think the matter out . [He]78-jack had left [the Chesterfords]135-the chesterfords in [January]31-january with a full realisation of [his]78-jack position . [He]78-jack was in love with [Dodo]79-dodo , perhaps more deeply than ever , and [Dodo]79-dodo was hopelessly , irrevocably out of [his]78-jack reach . The only thing left to be done was to get over it ; but [his]78-jack ordinary circle and its leisurely duties were quite impossible just at present , and [he]78-jack adopted the traditional English method of travelling , and shooting unoffending animals . Whether the absence of faith was responsible , is an open question ; at any rate , the remedy did not result in a cure . [He]78-jack was intensely bored with [foreign countries]2463-foreign countries ; [they]2463-foreign countries were quite as distasteful as [England]1-england , and , on the whole , had less to offer . And [he]78-jack came back to [London]2-london again as suddenly as [he]78-jack had left [it]2-london . "[860-you] [I]0-i hope [you]862-you are really better , " wrote [Dodo]79-dodo , "[0-i] though [I]0-i did n't know that [you]862-you were in any immediate danger of breaking down when [you]862-you left [us]863-us . " Of course [he]78-jack came back ; it was no good remaining abroad , and yawning in front of [the Sistine Madonna , who , in [her]2464-her impossible serene mildness , had no message whatever for [him]78-jack]136-the sistine madonna , who , in her impossible serene mildness , had no message whatever for him . [He]78-jack wanted to see [Dodo]79-dodo ; why on earth should n't [he]78-jack ? [She]79-dodo was the only thing [he]78-jack really cared about , and [she]79-dodo was quite out of [his]78-jack reach . Where was the harm ? For two days after [his]78-jack arrival in [London]2-london [he]78-jack was still undecided , and made no effort to see [her]79-dodo , and on the third day [her]79-dodo note came . [London]2-london was as bad as [Dresden]33-dresden , and again , where was the harm ? [He]78-jack wrote a note saying [he]78-jack would come , then [he]78-jack tore that up and sent a refusal , offering no excuse ; and after all , [he]78-jack had gone , and parted from [her]79-dodo with the words that [he]78-jack would come again the next day . But ah , how sweet it was to see [her]79-dodo again ! Such were the facts upon which [Jack]78-jack wished to form a conclusion . All this indecision was really too annoying . What was the use of a conscience that took the sugar out of [your]2465-your tea , and yet could not prevent [you]2465-your from drinking it ? It was not strong enough to prevent [him]78-jack going to see [Dodo]79-dodo , and it took the malicious line of making the visit as little enjoyable as possible . Well , it must be settled one way or the other . The problem obviously depended on one question . Did [his]78-jack desire for [Dodo]79-dodo grow stronger with seeing [her]79-dodo ? [He]78-jack decided that it did not make much difference to the quality or degree of [his]78-jack longing , but , on the other hand , [her]79-dodo society gave [him]78-jack an inestimable pleasure . When [she]79-dodo had refused [him]78-jack a year ago , [he]78-jack had gone on seeing [her]79-dodo day after day , without the horrible , unsatisfied emptiness [he]78-jack had felt abroad . That absorbing craving for [her]79-dodo , [he]78-jack remembered , began when [she]79-dodo was on [her]79-dodo wedding tour . Then why not see [her]79-dodo freely and frequently ? No harm could possibly come out of it . [She]79-dodo would certainly guess the reason , and if there was one possible solution of this stupid problem more undesirable than another , it was that . [I]0-i know [you]77-bertie 're not [a rascal]867-a rascal , but this is a thing one ca n't argue about . It is a matter of feeling . If [I]0-i thought any mischief could come of it , [I]0-i should deserve to be horse - whipped . " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't like it , " repeated [Bertie]77-bertie stolidly . [Jack]78-jack went to see [Dodo]79-dodo the next afternoon , and for many afternoons during the next fortnight [he]78-jack might have been seen on [Chesterford]80-chesterford 's doorstep , either coming or going . [[Her]79-dodo husband]387-her husband seemed almost as glad as [Dodo]79-dodo that [Jack]78-jack should come often . [His]78-jack visits were obviously very pleasant to [her]79-dodo , and [she]79-dodo had begun to talk nonsense again as fluently as ever . With [Jack]78-jack , however , [she]79-dodo had some rather serious talks ; [his]78-jack future appeared to be exercising [her]79-dodo mind somewhat . [Jack]78-jack 's life at this time was absolutely aimless . Before [he]78-jack had gone abroad [he]78-jack had been at [the Bar]2476-the bar , and had been called , but [[his]78-jack chambers]2477-his chambers now knew [him]78-jack no more . [He]78-jack had no [home]282-home duties , being , as [Dodo]79-dodo expressed it , "[0-i] [a poor little orphan of six foot two]870-a poor little orphan of six foot two , " and [he]78-jack had enough money for an idle bachelor life . [Dodo]79-dodo took a very real interest in the career of [[her]79-dodo friends]2037-her friends . It was part of [her]79-dodo completeness , as [I]0-i have said before , to be the centre of [a set of [successful people]2481-successful people]2480-a set of successful people . [Jack]78-jack could do very well , [she]79-dodo felt , in the purely ornamental line , and [she]79-dodo by no means wished to debar [him]78-jack from the ornamental profession , but yet [she]79-dodo was vaguely dissatisfied . [She]79-dodo induced [him]78-jack one day to state in full , exactly the ideas [he]78-jack had about [his]78-jack own future . "[0-i] [You]871-you dangle very well indeed , " [she]79-dodo said to [him]78-jack , "[871-you] and [I]0-i 'm far from wishing [you]871-you not to dangle , but , if it 's to be [your]871-you profession , [you]871-you must do it more systematically . [Lady Wrayston]137-lady wrayston was [here]2013-here yesterday , and [she]137-lady wrayston said [no one]2046-no one ever saw [you]871-you now . That 's lazy ; [you]871-you 're neglecting [your]871-you work . " [Jack]78-jack was silent a few minutes . The truth of the matter was that [he]78-jack was becoming so preoccupied with [Dodo]79-dodo , that [he]78-jack was acquiring a real distaste for [other society]2482-other society . [His]78-jack days seemed to have dwindled down to an hour or two hours each , according to the time [he]78-jack passed with [Dodo]79-dodo . The interval between [his]78-jack leaving [the house]2114-the house one day and returning to [it]2114-the house the next , had got to be merely a tedious period of waiting , which [he]78-jack would gladly have dispensed with . In such intervals society appeared to [him]78-jack not a distraction , but a laborious substitute for inaction , and labour at any time was not congenial to [him]78-jack . [His]78-jack life , in fact , was a series of conscious pulses with long - drawn pauses in between . [He]78-jack was dimly aware that this sort of thing could not go on for ever . The machine would stop , or get quicker or slower , and there were endless complications imminent in either case . "[137-lady wrayston] [I]0-i do n't know that [I]0-i really care for dangling , " said [Jack]78-jack discontentedly . "[0-i] At the same time it is the least objectionable form of amusement . " "[0-i] Well , [you]871-you ca n't dangle for ever in any case , " said [Dodo]79-dodo . "[871-you] [You]871-you ought to marry and settle down . [June]140-june was drawing to a close in a week of magnificent weather . It was too hot to do much during the middle of the day , and [the Park]244-the park was full of [riders]2486-riders every morning from eight till ten . [Dodo]79-dodo ' was frequently to be seen [there]267-there , usually riding [a vicious black mare]2488-a vicious black mare , that plunged and shied more than [Lord Chesterford]80-chesterford quite liked . But [Dodo]79-dodo insisted on riding it . Besides , [I]0-i can manage the brute . " On this particular morning [Dodo]79-dodo descended the stairs feeling unusually happy . The period of enforced idleness was over , and [she]79-dodo was making up for lost time with a vengeance . [They]2489-they had given a dance the night before , and [Dodo]79-dodo had not gone to bed till after four ; but for all that [she]79-dodo was down again at half - past eight , and [[her]79-dodo mare]2490-her mare was waiting for [her]79-dodo . " "[0-i] [You]78-jack judge so stupidly , " said [Dodo]79-dodo ; "[78-jack] [you]78-jack elevate matrimony into a sacrament . Now [I]0-i do n't . It is a contract for mutual advantage . Do n't frown , [Jack]78-jack . That 's [my]0-i eminently common - sense view of the question . It answers excellently , as [I]0-i find by experience . But , of course , there are marriages for love . [I]0-i suppose [most of [the lower middle - class]955-the lower middle - class]954-most of the lower middle - class marry for love , at least [they]954-most of the lower middle - class have n't got any position or wealth to marry for . [I]0-i daresay [[our]956-we great grandfathers]958-our great grandfathers married for love , but the fact that so many of [us]956-we do n't , shows that [ours]956-we is the more advanced and probably correct view . [You]959-you know [all wine - tasters]960-all wine - tasters agree on the superiority of one wine , and the inferiority of another . That 's the result of education . [The amateur]253-the amateur thinks [they]253-the amateur are all more or less alike , and very probably prefers some sweet bad kind . That 's the middle - class view of love - marriages . The more [I]0-i think of it , the more [I]0-i feel that love is an illusion . Think of [all the people who marry for love]962-all the people who marry for love , and get eternally tired of [each other afterwards]963-each other afterwards . [They]962-all the people who marry for love ca n't keep it up . [The lovers]964-the lovers grow into [friends]319-friends , and [the friends]966-the friends into [enemies]967-enemies . Those are [the enviable ones who remain friends]968-the enviable ones who remain friends ; but it is better to marry as [a friend]2029-a friend than as [a lover]2043-a lover , because in the latter case there is a reaction and a disappointment , which may perhaps ruin the friendship . Then [Jack]78-jack said , ‚Äî "[78-jack] No , [Dodo]79-dodo , [I]0-i have never got over it . " The moment after [he]78-jack had said it , [he]78-jack would have given [his]78-jack right hand to have it unsaid . [Dodo]79-dodo was silent for a moment , and [Jack]78-jack found [himself]78-jack noticing the tiny , trivial things about [him]78-jack . [He]78-jack observed a fly trying to alight oh [his]78-jack horse 's ear , but the animal flicked it off with a little jerk , before it got fairly settled . [He]78-jack wondered whether the fly had illusions about that ear , and whether it imagined that it would be happy for ever and ever , if it could once settle there . "[78-jack] [You]78-jack know [we]975-we are saying the most frightfully unconventional things to [each other]713-each other , " said [Dodo]79-dodo . "[78-jack] [I]0-i am very sorry for [you]78-jack , [Jack]78-jack , and [I]0-i will administer consolation . [The baby]283-the baby died this morning , half an hour after [you]79-dodo had gone . " [Dodo]79-dodo 's first feeling was one of passionate anger and resentment . [She]79-dodo felt [she]79-dodo had been duped and tricked in a most unjustifiable manner . [Fate]88-fate had led [her]79-dodo to expect some happy days , and [she]79-dodo had been cruelly disappointed . But [we]995-we can bear it together , [Dodo]79-dodo . " [Dodo]79-dodo turned from [him]0-i passionately , and left [him]0-i standing there . [Dodo]79-dodo was sitting in the window of [[her]79-dodo morning - room]2504-her morning - room late on the same afternoon . [She]79-dodo and [Lord Chesterford]80-chesterford had been together to look at [the baby]283-the baby as it lay there , with the little features that had been racked and distorted with pain , calm and set again , as if it only slept ; and [Dodo]79-dodo had at that moment one real pang of grief . [Her]79-dodo first impulse , as [we]995-we have seen , was one of anger and impatience at the stupidity of destiny . [She]79-dodo had been enjoying [herself]79-dodo , in a purely animal way so intensely , at that moment when [she]79-dodo saw [Mrs. Vivian]96-mrs. vivian waiting for [her]79-dodo under the trees . [She]79-dodo was just released from a tedious period of inactivity , and inactivity was to [Dodo]79-dodo worse than anything in [the Inferno]37-the inferno . "[79-dodo] [I]0-i daresay [I]0-i should get accustomed to being roasted , " [she]79-dodo had said once to [Miss Grantham]105-miss grantham . "[0-i] It really would be rather interesting seeing [your]996-your fingers curling up like fried bacon , but imagine being put in [a nicely - furnished room]997-a nicely - furnished room with [nobody]247-nobody to talk to , and a view over [Hyde Park]3-hyde park one side and [Melton Mowbray]145-melton mowbray the other , and never being able to get out ! The longer that lasted , the worse it would become . " And so [she]79-dodo had felt the sort of rapture with which "[999-the prisoner] [the prisoner]999-the prisoner leaps to loose [his]999-the prisoner chains " when [she]79-dodo had gone out that morning , and again knew the infinite delight of feeling a fine horse answer to [her]79-dodo hand , under a sort of playful protest . Then this had come upon [her]79-dodo , and [Dodo]79-dodo felt that language , failed [her]79-dodo to express [her]79-dodo profound contempt and dislike for the destiny that shapes [our]2506-our ends . But [her]79-dodo generosity and sense of fair play had come to [her]79-dodo aid . [She]79-dodo was not alone in this matter , and [she]79-dodo quite realised that it was worse for [Chesterford]80-chesterford than [herself]79-dodo . [Chesterford]80-chesterford had evinced the most intense interest in [the baby]283-the baby in [itself]283-the baby . [Dodo]79-dodo , on the other hand , had frankly declared that [the baby]283-the baby 's potentialities possessed a far greater attraction , for [her]79-dodo than its actualities . But [she]79-dodo had voluntarily linked [her]79-dodo life with [his]80-chesterford ; and [she]79-dodo must do [her]79-dodo part ‚Äî [they]2509-they had had a great loss , and [he]80-chesterford must not feel that [he]80-chesterford bore it alone . [Dodo]79-dodo shook [her]79-dodo head hopelessly over the unknown factor , that made [her]79-dodo so much to [him]80-chesterford , and left [him]80-chesterford so little to [her]79-dodo , but [she]79-dodo accepted it as inevitable . Almost immediately after [she]79-dodo had left [him]80-chesterford in [the hall]336-the hall , [she]79-dodo felt angry with [herself]79-dodo for haying done so , just as [she]79-dodo had been vexed at [her]79-dodo reception of [his]80-chesterford proposal of family prayers , and a few minutes afterwards [she]79-dodo sent for [him]80-chesterford , and [they]2509-they had gone together to see [the baby]283-the baby . And then , because [she]79-dodo was [a woman]323-a woman , because [she]79-dodo was human , because [she]79-dodo was genuinely sorry for [this honest true man who knelt beside [her]79-dodo and sobbed as if [his]80-chesterford heart was broken , but with a natural instinct turned to [her]79-dodo , and sorrowed more for [her]79-dodo than for [himself]80-chesterford]2513-this honest true man who knelt beside her and sobbed as if his heart was broken , but with a natural instinct turned to her , and sorrowed more for her than for himself , [her]79-dodo intense self - centredness for the time vanished , and with a true and womanly instinct [she]79-dodo found [her]79-dodo consolation in consoling [him]80-chesterford . [Dodo]79-dodo felt as if [she]79-dodo had lived years since this morning , and longed to cut the next week out of [her]79-dodo life , to lose it altogether . [She]79-dodo wanted to get away out of the whole course of events , to begin again without any past . From a purely worldly point of view [she]79-dodo was intensely vexed at [the baby]283-the baby 's death ; [she]79-dodo had felt an immense pride in having provided [an heir]2515-an heir , and it was all no use ; it was over , it might as well never have been born . And , as the day wore on , [she]79-dodo felt an overwhelming disgust of all the days that were to follow , [the darkened house]2516-the darkened house , the quieted movements , the enforced idleness . If only [no one]2046-no one knew , [Dodo]79-dodo felt that [she]79-dodo would fling [herself]79-dodo at once , this very minute , into [the outside world]2518-the outside world again . What was the use of all this retirement ? It only made a bad job worse . Surely , when misfortune comes on one , it is best to forget it as soon as possible , and [Dodo]79-dodo 's eminently practical way of forgetting anything was to absorb [herself]79-dodo in something else . "[1000-a sensible man] What [a sensible man]1000-a sensible man [David]146-david was , " [she]79-dodo thought . "[146-david] [He]146-david went and oiled [himself]146-david , which , [I]0-i suppose , is the equivalent of putting on one 's very best evening dress . " [She]79-dodo felt an inward laughter , more than half hysterical , as to what would happen if [she]79-dodo went and oiled [Chesterford]80-chesterford . " That same evening [Edith Staines]104-edith and [Miss Grantham]105-miss grantham were seated together in a box at [the opera]2523-the opera . The first act was just over , and [Edith]104-edith , who had mercilessly silenced every remark [Miss Grantham]105-miss grantham had made during it , relaxed a little . [Miss Grantham]105-miss grantham 's method of looking at an opera was to sit with [her]104-edith hack to the stage , so as to command a better view of [the house]2114-the house , and talk continuously . But [Edith]104-edith would not stand that . [She]104-edith had before [her]104-edith a large quarto containing the full score , and [she]104-edith had a pencil in [her]104-edith hand with which [she]104-edith entered little corrections , and now and then [she]104-edith made comments to [herself]104-edith . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall tell [Mancinelli]147-mancinelli of that , " [she]104-edith murmured . "[0-i] The whole point of the motif is that rapid run with [the minim]1026-the minim at the end , and [he]1027-he actually allowed that beast to make a rallentando . " But the act was over now , and [she]104-edith shut the book with a bang . "[1027-he] Come outside , [Grantie]109-grantie , " [she]104-edith said , "[109-grantie] it 's so fearfully hot . "[0-i] [I]0-i have a genius for spoiling things , " thought [Jack]78-jack to [himself]78-jack . "[0-i] Everything was going right ; [I]0-i was seeing [Dodo]79-dodo enough to keep [me]0-i happy , and free from that hateful feeling of last autumn , and then [I]0-i spoilt it all by a stupid remark that could do no good , nor help [me]0-i in any conceivable way . How will [Dodo]79-dodo have taken it ? " But [he]78-jack was quite sure of one thing ‚Äî [he]78-jack would not go and see [Mrs. Vivian]96-mrs. vivian . [He]78-jack was , [he]78-jack felt , possessed of all the facts of the case , and [he]78-jack was competent to form a judgment on [them]2537-them ‚Äî at any rate [Mrs. Vivian]96-mrs. vivian was not competent to do it for [him]78-jack . No , [he]78-jack would give it another chance . [He]78-jack would again reason out the pros and cons of the case , [he]78-jack would be quite honest , and [he]78-jack would act accordingly . That [he]78-jack should arrive at the same conclusion was inevitable . The one thing in [the world]321-the world that [no man]2539-no man can account for , or allow for , is change in [himself]2539-no man . If [Jack]78-jack had been able to foresee , when [he]78-jack went abroad , that [he]78-jack would be acting thus with regard to [Dodo]79-dodo , [he]78-jack would have thought [himself]78-jack mad , and it would have been as impossible for [him]78-jack to act thus then , as it was inevitable for [him]78-jack to act thus now . If [we]2540-our judge by [our]2540-our own standards , and [our]2540-our own standards alter , [we]2540-our can not expect [our]2540-our verdicts to remain invariable . Under a strong attachment [a man]279-a man drifts , and [he]279-a man can not at any one moment allow for , or feel the force of the current , for [he]279-a man is moving in it , though [he]279-a man thinks [himself]279-a man at rest . The horrible necessities of cause and effect work in [us]2540-our , as well as around [us]2540-our . As [Edith]124-edith had said , [his]279-a man sense of security was [his]279-a man danger , for [his]279-a man standard of security was not the same as it had been . [He]279-a man sat down and wrote a note to [Mrs. Vivian]96-mrs. vivian , saying that [he]279-a man regretted being unable to call on [her]96-mrs. vivian to - morrow , and purposely forebore to give any reason . [He]279-a man had considerable faith in [her]96-mrs. vivian power of reading between the lines , and the fact , baldly stated , was an unnecessary affront to [her]96-mrs. vivian intellect . [Mrs. Vivian]96-mrs. vivian read the note with very little surprise , but with a good deal of regret . [She]96-mrs. vivian was genuinely sorry for [him]279-a man , but [she]96-mrs. vivian had other means at [her]96-mrs. vivian disposal , though they were not so pleasant to use . " It was just three weeks after [the baby]283-the baby 's death , and [Dodo]79-dodo was sitting in [[her]79-dodo room]2115-her room about eleven o'clock in the morning , yawning dismally over a novel , but [she]79-dodo was conscious of a certain relief , a sense of effort suspended . Late the evening before , [Lord Chesterford]80-chesterford had consulted [her]79-dodo about some business down at [Harchester]19-harchester , and [Dodo]79-dodo , in a moment of inspiration , had said that it must be done by [someone on the spot]2553-someone on the spot , that [an agent]2554-an agent was not to be trusted , and that if [Chesterford]80-chesterford liked [she]79-dodo would go . This , of course , led to [his]80-chesterford offering to go [himself]80-chesterford , and would [Dodo]79-dodo come with [him]80-chesterford ? [Dodo]79-dodo had replied that [she]79-dodo was quite willing to go , but that there was no need of both of [them]2555-them making a tiresome journey on an infernally hot day . [Chesterford]80-chesterford had felt , rather wistfully , that [he]80-chesterford would not mind the journey if [Dodo]79-dodo was with [him]80-chesterford , but [he]80-chesterford had learned lately not to say such things . [Dodo]79-dodo was apt to treat them as nonsense . "[79-dodo] [My]0-i coming with [you]1123-you would n't make it any cooler , or less insufferably dusty , " [she]79-dodo would have said . The result was that [Chesterford]80-chesterford went , and [Dodo]79-dodo was left alone ' in [London]2-london , with a distinct sense of relief and relaxation . [Dodo]79-dodo 's next move was to send a note to [Jack]78-jack , saying that [he]78-jack was going to come and lunch with [her]79-dodo . [She]79-dodo was not conscious of any sense of deception in this , but [she]79-dodo had seen that [Chesterford]80-chesterford had not cared to see [anybody]462-anybody since [the baby]283-the baby 's death , except [Mrs. Vivian]96-mrs. vivian , whereas [she]79-dodo longed to be in the midst of [people]308-people again . [She]79-dodo was quite alive to the truth of [Mrs. Vivian]96-mrs. vivian 's remarks . But though [Dodo]79-dodo felt a great relief in [[her]79-dodo husband]387-her husband 's absence , [she]79-dodo was more than ever conscious of the unutterable stupidity of spending , day after day doing nothing . Then [she]79-dodo went back [home]282-home , and found [Lord Ledgers]103-lord ledgers , whom [she]79-dodo put through [his]103-lord ledgers paces , and then [she]79-dodo had tea , and dressed for the ball . [She]79-dodo had ordered a very remarkable ball - dress from [Worth]168-worth 's , just before [the baby]283-the baby 's death , which had never yet seen the light . It was a soft grey texture , which [Dodo]79-dodo said looked like a sunlit mist , and it was strictly half mourning . [She]79-dodo felt it was a badge of [her]79-dodo freedom , and put it on with a fresh burst of exultation . [She]79-dodo had a large bouquet of orchids , which [Lord Bretton]169-lord bretton had caused to be sent [her]79-dodo , and a fan painted by [Watteau]170-watteau , and [a French hair - dresser]2574-a french hair - dresser came and "[78-jack] did " [her]79-dodo hair . " [Lord Chesterford]80-chesterford was not as meek as [Moses]173-moses . [He]80-chesterford was capable of a sense of injustice . But [I]0-i do n't mean to quarrel with [you]129-tommy . " [Lord Chesterford]80-chesterford turned into [[his]80-chesterford room]2284-his room . But [he]80-chesterford would not keep [Dodo]79-dodo , as [she]79-dodo wished to go , even if [he]80-chesterford could have done so . [Ledgers]103-lord ledgers was waiting in [the carriage]992-the carriage . "[0-i] Oh , the devil , " said [Dodo]79-dodo , as [she]79-dodo stepped in . [Lady Bretton]152-lady bretton 's ball is still talked about , [I]0-i believe , in certain circles , though it ought to have been consigned , with all other events of last year , to oblivion . It was very brilliant , and [several princes]2583-several princes shed the light of [their]2583-several princes presence on it . But , as [Lord Ledgers]103-lord ledgers was heard to remark afterwards , "[0-i] There are [many princes]1175-many princes , but there is only one [Dodo]79-dodo . " [He]80-chesterford felt as if [he]80-chesterford was adapting a quotation from the Koran , which was somehow suitable to the positive solemnity of the occasion . [Dodo]79-dodo can only be described as having been indescribable . [Lucas]153-lucas , [[Lady Bretton]152-lady bretton 's eldest son]2584-lady bretton 's eldest son , in honour of whose coming of age the ball was given , can hardly allude to it even now . [His]153-lucas emotions expressed themselves feebly in [his]153-lucas dressing with even more care than usual , in hanging round [Eaton Square]25-eaton square , and in leaving cards on [the Chesterfords]135-the chesterfords as often as was decent . [Dodo]79-dodo was conscious of a frenzied desire to make the most of it , and to drown remembrance , for in the background of [her]79-dodo mind was another picture , that [she]79-dodo did not care to look at . There was [a man [she]79-dodo knew]2585-a man she knew , leaning over [a small dead child]2586-a small dead child . The door of [the room]339-the room was half open , and [a woman , brilliantly dressed]2588-a woman , brilliantly dressed , was turning to go out , looking back over [her]2588-a woman , brilliantly dressed shoulder with a smile , half of impatience , half of pity , at [the kneeling figure in [the room]339-the room]2589-the kneeling figure in the room . Through the half - open door came sounds of music and rhythmical steps , and a blaze of light . This picture had started unbidden into [Dodo]79-dodo 's mind , as [she]79-dodo and [Ledgers]103-lord ledgers drove up to [Lady Bretton]152-lady bretton 's door , with such sudden clearness that [she]79-dodo half wondered whether [she]79-dodo had ever actually seen it . It reminded [her]79-dodo of one of [Orchardson]174-orchardson 's silent , well - appointed tragedies . In any case it gave [her]79-dodo a rather unpleasant twinge , and [she]79-dodo determined to shut it out for the rest of the evening , and , to do [her]79-dodo justice , [no one]2046-no one would have guessed that [Dodo]79-dodo 's brilliance was due to anything but pure spontaneity , or that , even in the deepest shades of [her]79-dodo inmost mind , there was any remembrance that it needed an effort to stifle . [Many women]2592-many women , though [few men]2593-few men , were surprised to see [her]79-dodo [there]267-there , and there was [no one who was not glad]2595-no one who was not glad ; but the question arose more than once in the minds of [two or three people]1088-two or three people , "[79-dodo] Would [society]1176-society stand it if [she]1177-she did n't happen to be [herself]1177-she ? " [Dodo]79-dodo had treated [a select party of [[her]79-dodo friends]2037-her friends]2597-a select party of her friends to a private exhibition of skirt - dancing during supper - time . The music from [the band]2599-the band was quite loud enough to be heard distinctly in [a small , rather unfrequented sitting - out room]2600-a small , rather unfrequented sitting - out room , and there [Dodo]79-dodo had displayed [her]79-dodo incomparable grace of movement and limb to the highest advantage . [Dodo]79-dodo danced that night with unusual perfection , and who has not felt the exquisite beauty of such motion ? [Her]79-dodo figure , clad in its long , clinging folds of diaphanous , almost luminous texture , stood out like a radiant statue of dawn against the dark panelling of [the room]339-the room ; [her]79-dodo graceful figure bending this way and that , [her]79-dodo wonderful white arms now holding aside [her]79-dodo long skirt , or clasped above [her]79-dodo head ; above all , the supreme distinction and conscious modesty of every posture seemed , to [the little circle who saw [her]79-dodo]2602-the little circle who saw her , to be almost a new revelation of the perfection of form , colour and grace . [Jack]78-jack knew [Dodo]79-dodo pretty well , but [he]78-jack stood and wondered . Was [she]79-dodo [a devil]2603-a devil ? was [she]79-dodo a tiger ? or was [she]79-dodo , after all , [a woman]323-a woman ? [Dodo]79-dodo had told [him]78-jack what had happened that evening , and yet [he]78-jack did not condemn [her]79-dodo utterly . [He]78-jack knew how prison - like [her]79-dodo life must have been to [her]79-dodo during the last month . It was a thousand pities that [Dodo]79-dodo 's meat was [Chesterford]80-chesterford 's poison , but [he]78-jack no more blamed [Dodo]79-dodo for eating [her]79-dodo meat than [he]78-jack blamed [Chesterford]80-chesterford for avoiding [his]78-jack poison ; and to advance the conventional argument against [Dodo]79-dodo , that [her]79-dodo behaviour was not usual , was , equivalent to saying , "[1177-she] Why do [you]1178-you behave like [yourself]1178-you ? " rather than , "[1178-you] Why do n't [you]1178-you behave like [other people]2176-other people ? " [Dodo]79-dodo 's estimate of [herself]79-dodo , as purely normal , was only another instance of [her]79-dodo very abnormalness . No , on the whole , [she]79-dodo was [not a devil]2605-not a devil . The other question was harder to settle . [Jack]78-jack remembered a tigress [he]78-jack had seen that day with [her]79-dodo at [the Zoo]1160-the zoo . [The brute]2570-the brute had a small and perfectly fascinating tiger cub , in which [she]79-dodo took a certain maternal pride ; but when feeding - time came near , and the cub continued to be importunate , [she]79-dodo gave it a cuff with [her]79-dodo big velvety paw , and sent it staggering to the corner . [Dodo]79-dodo 's tiger cub was a mixture between [Chesterford]80-chesterford and [the dead child]2608-the dead child , and [Dodo]79-dodo 's feeding - time had come round . Here [she]79-dodo was feeding with an enviable appetite , and where was the cub ? The tigress element was not wholly absent . And yet , withal , [she]79-dodo was [a woman]323-a woman . Is it that certain attributes of pure womanliness run through the female of animals , or that [every woman]2610-every woman has a touch of the tigress about [her]2610-every woman ? [Jack]78-jack felt incompetent to decide . [Dodo]79-dodo 's dance came to an end . [She]79-dodo accepted [Prince Waldenech]155-prince waldenech 's arm , and went down to supper . As [he]155-prince waldenech advanced to [her]79-dodo , [Dodo]79-dodo dropped a curtsey , and [he]155-prince waldenech stooped and kissed [her]79-dodo hand . "[2570-the brute] [The brute]2570-the brute , " thought [Jack]78-jack , as [he]78-jack strolled out into [the ballroom]2611-the ballroom , where [people]308-people were beginning to collect again . [Many]2613-many turned and looked at [Dodo]79-dodo as , [she]79-dodo passed out with [[her]79-dodo handsome partner]2614-her handsome partner . The glow of exercise and excitement and success burned brightly in [her]79-dodo cheeks , and [no one]2046-no one accused [Dodo]79-dodo of using rouge . The supper was spread on a number of small tables , laid for four or six each . [The Prince]2616-the prince led [her]79-dodo to an empty one , and sat down by [her]79-dodo side . "[2570-the brute] [I]0-i have seen many beautiful things , " [he]0-i said , in French , which permits [a man]279-a man to say more than [he]279-a man may [I]0-i in English , "[0-i] but none so beautiful as what [I]0-i have seen to - night . " [Dodo]79-dodo was far too accomplished [a coquette]2618-a coquette to pretend not to know what [he]0-i meant . [She]79-dodo made [him]0-i [a charming little obeisance]2619-a charming little obeisance . "[0-i] Politeness required that of [[your]0-i Highness]1181-your highness , " [she]79-dodo said . "[1181-your highness] That is only [my]0-i due , [you]0-i know . " "[0-i] [I]0-i can never give [you]0-i [your]0-i due , " said [he]0-i . "[0-i] [My]0-i due in this case is the knowledge [I]0-i have pleased [you]0-i . " [Dodo]79-dodo felt suddenly a little uncomfortable . The forgotten picture flashed for a moment across [her]79-dodo inward eye . [She]79-dodo spoke of other things : praised the prettiness of [the ballroom]2611-the ballroom , the excellence of [the band]2599-the band . "[0-i] [Lady Bretton]152-lady bretton has given a fine setting to the diamond , " said [the Prince]2616-the prince , "[152-lady bretton] but the diamond is not [hers]152-lady bretton . " [Dodo]79-dodo laughed . [He]0-i was a little ponderous , and [he]0-i deserved to be told so . "[152-lady bretton] [[You]0-i [Austrians]1183-austrians]1182-you austrians have beautiful manners , " [she]152-lady bretton said , "[1183-austrians] but [you]0-i are too serious . [English]175-english are always accused of sharing that fault , but anyhow , when [they]1184-they pay compliments , [they]1184-they have at least the air of not meaning what [they]1184-they say . " "[1184-they] That is the fault of [the English]1185-the english , or of the compliment . " "[2046-no one] [No one]2046-no one means what [they]2046-no one say when [they]2046-no one pay compliments , " said [Dodo]79-dodo . "[2046-no one] [They]2046-no one are only a kind of formula to avoid the unpleasantness of saying nothing . " "[163-austrians] [Austrians]163-austrians seldom pay compliments , " said [he]155-prince waldenech ; "[163-austrians] but when [they]163-austrians do , [they]163-austrians mean [them]2046-no one . " "[163-austrians] Ouf , " said [Dodo]79-dodo ; "[163-austrians] that sounds homelike to [you]0-i , does n't it ? All [Austrians]163-austrians say ' ouf ' in books ‚Äî do [they]163-austrians really say ' ouf , ' by the way?‚ÄîWhat a bald way of saying that [I]0-i need n't expect any more to - night . Really , [Prince]155-prince waldenech , that 's rather unflattering to [you]0-i . No , do n't excuse [yourself]0-i ; [I]0-i understand perfectly . [I]0-i 'm not fishing for any more . Come , there 's the pas de quatre beginning . That 's the ' Old [Kent]42-kent Road ' tune . It 's much the best . What do [you]0-i suppose ' Knocked 'em in [the Old Kent Road]1187-the old kent road ' means ? [No foreigner]1188-no foreigner has ever been able to translate it to [me]0-i yet . This is [your]0-i dance , is n't it ? O dear [me]0-i , half the night 's gone , and [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i had n't begun yet . [Some people]589-some people are in bed now ; what a waste of time , [you]0-i know . " The ball went on and on , and [Dodo]79-dodo seemed to gather fresh strength and brilliance with each hour . Extra dances were added and still added , and [many who were tired with dancing]2623-many who were tired with dancing stayed and watched [her]79-dodo . [The princes]2624-the princes went away , and [nobody]247-nobody noticed [their]2624-the princes departure . If [Cleopatra]176-cleopatra [herself]176-cleopatra had suddenly entered [the ballroom]2611-the ballroom , [she]176-cleopatra would have found [herself]176-cleopatra at a discount . It was the culmination of [Dodo]79-dodo 's successes . [She]79-dodo seemed different in kind , as well as in degree , from [the crowd around [her]79-dodo]2627-the crowd around her . [Pretty women]2628-pretty women seemed suddenly plain and middle - aged ; [well - dressed women]2629-well - dressed women looked dowdy beside [her]79-dodo , and when at length , as the electric light began to pale perceptibly before the breaking day , [Dodo]79-dodo asked [[her]79-dodo partner]2630-her partner to take [her]79-dodo to [Lady Bretton]152-lady bretton , [the dancers]2631-the dancers stopped , and followed [Dodo]79-dodo and [Prince Waldenech]155-prince waldenech , for [she]79-dodo was dancing with [him]155-prince waldenech , to where [Lady Bretton]152-lady bretton was standing . "[589-some people] It has been heavenly , " said [Dodo]79-dodo . "[589-some people] It 's a dreadful bore to have [people]308-people come and say how much [they]308-people have enjoyed [themselves]308-people , but [I]0-i 've done it now . Tell [Lucas]153-lucas [I]0-i wish [he]153-lucas would come of age every year ; [he]153-lucas really is [a public benefactor]1191-a public benefactor . " [She]79-dodo took [Prince Waldenech]155-prince waldenech 's arm , and stood waiting with [him]155-prince waldenech , while [[her]79-dodo carriage]2632-her carriage detached [itself]2632-her carriage from the others which lined [the square]2633-the square , and drove up to the door . And , as [they]2634-they stood there , [the crowd]274-the crowd followed [her]79-dodo slowly out of [the ballroom]2611-the ballroom , still silent , and still watching [her]79-dodo , and lined the stairs , as [she]79-dodo passed down to the front door . Then , when [she]79-dodo had got into [[her]79-dodo carriage]2632-her carriage , and had driven off , [they]2634-they looked at [each other]713-each other as if [they]2634-they had all been walking in [their]2634-they sleep , and [no one]2046-no one knew exactly why [they]2634-they were there . And a quarter of an hour later [the rooms]2640-the rooms were completely empty . Meanwhile , as [Dodo]79-dodo drove back through the still , cool , morning air , [she]79-dodo threw down the windows of [[her]79-dodo carriage]2632-her carriage , and drew in deep satisfied breaths of its freshness . [She]79-dodo thought of the crowds who had followed [her]79-dodo down to the door , and laughed for pleasure . "[153-lucas] It 's life , it 's life , " [she]79-dodo thought . "[1192-they] [They]1192-they followed [me]0-i like sheep . Ah , how [I]0-i love it ! " It was nearly six when [she]79-dodo reached [home]282-home ; "[1192-they] Decidedly it would be too absurd to go to bed , " [she]79-dodo thought . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall go for a glorious gallop , and come back to breakfast with [Chesterford]80-chesterford . And tell [Lord Chesterford]80-chesterford , when [he]80-chesterford wakes , that [I]0-i shall be back to breakfast . " [Chesterford]80-chesterford did not let [Dodo]79-dodo see how strongly [he]80-chesterford had felt on the subject of the ball . [He]80-chesterford argued to [himself]80-chesterford that it would do no good . [Dodo]79-dodo would not understand , or , understanding , would misunderstand the strength of [his]80-chesterford feeling , and [he]80-chesterford did not care that [she]79-dodo should know that [he]80-chesterford thought [her]79-dodo heartless . [He]80-chesterford was quite conscious that matters were a little strained between [them]2644-them , though [Dodo]79-dodo apparently was sublimely unaware , of it . [She]79-dodo had a momentary nervousness when [they]2644-them met at breakfast , on the morning after the ball , that [Chesterford]80-chesterford was going to make a fuss , and [she]79-dodo could not quite see what it would end in , if the subject was broached . But [he]80-chesterford came in looking as usual . [He]80-chesterford told [her]79-dodo how matters had gone with [him]80-chesterford on the previous day , and had recounted , with a certain humour , a few sharp words which [an old lady in [[his]80-chesterford railway carriage]2646-his railway carriage had addressed to [him]80-chesterford]2645-an old lady in his railway carriage had addressed to him , because [he]80-chesterford did n't help [her]79-dodo to hand out two large cages of canaries which [she]79-dodo was taking [home]282-home . [Dodo]79-dodo welcomed all this as a sign of grace , and was only too happy to meet [[her]79-dodo husband]387-her husband half - way . [He]80-chesterford had been a trifle melodramatic on the previous evening , but [we]2644-them are all liable to make mountains out of molehills at times , [she]79-dodo thought . Personally [her]79-dodo inclination was to make molehills out of [mountains]924-mountains , but that was only a difference in temperament ; both implied a judgment at fault , and [she]79-dodo was quite willing to forgive and forget . In a word , [she]79-dodo was particularly nice to [him]80-chesterford , and when breakfast was over [she]79-dodo took [his]80-chesterford arm , and led [him]80-chesterford away to [[her]79-dodo room]2115-her room . "[0-i] Sit down in that very big chair , [old boy]290-old boy , " [she]79-dodo said , "[290-old boy] and twiddle [your]290-old boy thumbs while [I]0-i write some notes . [Dodo]79-dodo proceeded to write [her]79-dodo notes , and threw them one by one at [[her]79-dodo husband]387-her husband as [he]387-her husband sat contentedly by the window , in the very big chair that [Dodo]79-dodo had indicated . [Dodo]79-dodo 's correspondence was as varied as the collection of photographs on [her]79-dodo mantelpiece . The first note was to [[her]79-dodo groom]2653-her groom at [Winston]17-winston , telling [him]2653-her groom to have another riding - horse sent up at once , as [her]79-dodo own particular mare had gone lame . It missed [Chesterford]80-chesterford 's head , and fell with an ominous clatter among some bric - √† - brac and china . [He]0-i was suddenly frightened . [He]0-i came closer to [her]79-dodo . "[1236-we] Far apart , [Dodo]79-dodo ? [We]1236-we ? " "[79-dodo] It seems to [me]0-i that this interview has revealed some astonishing differences of opinion between [us]1236-we , " [she]79-dodo said . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't wish to multiply words . Or perhaps [you]79-dodo wish to lock [me]0-i up . [We]1236-we quite understand [one another]1006-one another . Let [us]1236-we agree to differ . Give [me]0-i that note , please . [I]0-i suppose [you]79-dodo can trust [me]0-i not to send it . [I]0-i should like to keep it . It is interesting to count the milestones . " [Dodo]79-dodo spoke with the recklessness of [a woman]323-a woman 's anger , which is always much more unwanton than that of [a man]279-a man . [A man]279-a man does not say cruel things when [he]279-a man is angry , because they are cruel , but because [he]279-a man is angry . [Dodo]79-dodo was cruel because [she]79-dodo wished to be cruel . [He]0-i gave [her]79-dodo the note , and turned to leave [the room]339-the room . [Dodo]79-dodo 's last speech made it impossible for [him]0-i to say more . The only thing [he]0-i would not sacrifice to [his]0-i love was [his]0-i honour or [hers]79-dodo . But [Dodo]79-dodo suddenly saw the horrible impossibility of the situation . [She]79-dodo had not the smallest intention of living on bad terms with [[her]79-dodo husband]387-her husband . [They]2659-they had quarrelled , it was a pity , but it was over . A storm may only clear the air ; it is not always the precursor of bad weather . The air wanted clearing , and [Dodo]79-dodo determined that it should not be the prelude of rain and wind . To [her]79-dodo , of course , the knowledge that [she]79-dodo did not love [[her]79-dodo husband]387-her husband had long been a commonplace , but to [him]0-i the truth was coming in fierce , blinding flashes , and by [their]2659-they light [he]0-i could see that a great flood had come down into [[his]0-i happy valley]2661-his happy valley , carrying desolation before it , and between [him]0-i and [Dodo]79-dodo stretched a tawny waste of water . But [Dodo]79-dodo had no intention of quarrelling with [him]0-i , or maintaining a dignified reserve in [their]1240-their daily intercourse . That would be quite unbearable , and [she]79-dodo wished there to be no misunderstanding on that point . "[80-chesterford] [Chesterford]80-chesterford , " [she]79-dodo said , "[80-chesterford] [we]1240-their 've quarrelled , and that 's a pity . [I]0-i hardly ever quarrel , and it was stupid of [me]0-i . [I]0-i am sorry . But [I]0-i have no intention of standing on [my]0-i dignity , and [I]0-i sha'n't allow [you]80-chesterford to stand on [yours]80-chesterford . [I]0-i shall pull [you]80-chesterford down , and [you]80-chesterford 'll go flop . [You]80-chesterford object to something which [I]0-i propose to do , [you]80-chesterford exert [your]80-chesterford rights , as far as having [him]80-chesterford in [the house]2114-the house goes , and [I]0-i exert [mine]0-i by going to see [him]80-chesterford . [I]0-i shall go this afternoon . [Your]80-chesterford veto on [his]80-chesterford coming to [Winston]17-winston seems quite as objectionable to [me]0-i , as [my]0-i going to see [him]80-chesterford does to [you]80-chesterford . That 's [our]1242-our position ; accept it . Let [us]1242-our understand [each other]713-each other completely . [C'est aimer]1244-c'est aimer . " As [she]1244-c'est aimer spoke [she]1244-c'est aimer recovered [her]1244-c'est aimer equanimity , and [she]1244-c'est aimer smiled serenely on [him]80-chesterford . Scenes like this left no impression on [her]1244-c'est aimer . The tragedy passed over [her]1244-c'est aimer head ; and , though it was written in the lines of [[her]1244-c'est aimer husband]387-her husband 's face , [she]1244-c'est aimer did not trouble to read it . [She]1244-c'est aimer got up from [her]1244-c'est aimer chair and went to [him]80-chesterford . " [Chesterford]80-chesterford , meanwhile , was standing in [the hall]336-the hall , feeling helpless and bewildered . This sort of thing was always happening now , do what [he]80-chesterford could ; and the intervals were not much better . [Dodo]79-dodo treated [him]80-chesterford with a passive tolerance that was very hard to bear . Even [her]79-dodo frank determination to keep on good terms with [[her]79-dodo husband]387-her husband had undergone considerable modification . [She]79-dodo was silent and indifferent . Now and then when [he]80-chesterford came into [[her]79-dodo room]2115-her room [he]80-chesterford heard , as [he]80-chesterford passed down [the passage]2668-the passage , the sound of [her]79-dodo piano or [her]79-dodo voice , but when [he]80-chesterford entered [Dodo]79-dodo would break off and ask [him]80-chesterford what [he]80-chesterford wanted . [He]80-chesterford half wished that [he]80-chesterford did not love [her]79-dodo , but [he]80-chesterford found [himself]80-chesterford sickening and longing for [Dodo]79-dodo to behave to [him]80-chesterford as [she]79-dodo used . It would have been something to know that [his]80-chesterford presence was not positively distasteful to [her]79-dodo . [Dodo]79-dodo no longer "[1275-he] kept it up , " as [Jack]78-jack said . [She]79-dodo did not pat [his]80-chesterford hand , or call [him]80-chesterford [a silly old dear]2669-a silly old dear , or pull [his]80-chesterford moustache , as once [she]79-dodo did . [He]80-chesterford had once taken those little things as a sign of [her]79-dodo love . [He]80-chesterford had found in [them]2670-them the pleasure that [Dodo]79-dodo 's smallest action always had for [him]80-chesterford ; but now even they , the husk and shell of what had never existed , had gone from [him]80-chesterford , and [he]80-chesterford was left with that which was at once [his]80-chesterford greatest sorrow and [his]80-chesterford greatest joy , [his]80-chesterford own love for [Dodo]79-dodo . And [Dodo]79-dodo ‚Äî God help [him]80-chesterford ! [he]80-chesterford had learned it well enough now ‚Äî [Dodo]79-dodo did not love [him]80-chesterford , and never had loved [him]80-chesterford . [He]80-chesterford wondered what the end would be ‚Äî whether [his]80-chesterford love , too , would die . In that case [he]80-chesterford foresaw that [they]2671-they would very likely go on living together as [fifty other people]1079-fifty other people lived ‚Äî being polite to [each other]713-each other , and gracefully tolerant of [each other]713-each other 's presence ; that [nobody]247-nobody would know , and [the world]321-the world would say , "[1275-he] What [a model and excellent couple]1276-a model and excellent couple . " So [he]80-chesterford stood there , biting the ends of [his]80-chesterford long moustache . Then [he]80-chesterford said to [himself]80-chesterford , "[0-i] [I]0-i was beastly to [her]1277-her . What the devil made [me]0-i say all those things . " [He]80-chesterford went back to [the dining - room]2312-the dining - room , and found [Dodo]79-dodo as [he]80-chesterford had left [her]79-dodo . "[0-i] [Dodo]79-dodo , [dear]545-dear , " [he]0-i said , "[79-dodo] forgive [me]0-i for being so cross . [I]0-i said a lot of abominable things . " [Dodo]79-dodo was rather amused . " [Chesterford]80-chesterford was disappointed and chilled . [He]80-chesterford turned on [his]80-chesterford heel and went out again . [Dodo]79-dodo raised [her]79-dodo eyebrows , shrugged [her]79-dodo shoulders imperceptibly , and returned to [her]79-dodo letter . " But [Chesterford]80-chesterford , to whom daily intercourse had become an awful struggle between [his]80-chesterford passionate love for [Dodo]79-dodo and [his]80-chesterford bitter disappointment at what [he]80-chesterford would certainly have partly attributed to [his]80-chesterford own stupidity and inadequacy , could have named the day and hour when [he]80-chesterford first realised how far [he]80-chesterford was apart from [[his]80-chesterford wife]325-his wife . It was when [he]80-chesterford returned by [the earlier train]1164-the earlier train and met [Dodo]79-dodo in [the hall]336-the hall going to [her]79-dodo dance ; that moment had thrown a dangerous clear light over the previous month . [He]80-chesterford argued to [himself]80-chesterford , with fatal correctness , that [Dodo]79-dodo could not have stopped caring for [him]80-chesterford in a moment , and [he]80-chesterford was driven to the inevitable conclusion that [she]79-dodo had been drifting away from [him]80-chesterford for a long time before that ; indeed , had [she]79-dodo ever been near [him]80-chesterford ? But [he]80-chesterford was deeply grateful to those months when [he]80-chesterford had deceived [himself]80-chesterford , or [she]79-dodo had deceived [him]80-chesterford , into believing that [she]79-dodo cared for [him]80-chesterford . [He]80-chesterford knew well that [they]2682-they had been the happiest in [his]80-chesterford life , and though the subsequent disappointment was bitter , it had not embittered [him]80-chesterford . [His]80-chesterford love for [Dodo]79-dodo had a sacredness for [him]80-chesterford that nothing could remove ; it was something separate from the rest of [his]80-chesterford life , that had stooped from [heaven]2683-heaven and entered into it , and lo ! it was glorified . That memory was [his]80-chesterford for ever , nothing could rob [him]80-chesterford of that . In [August Dodo]79-dodo had left [him]80-chesterford . [They]2682-they had settled a series of visits in [Scotland]46-scotland , after a fortnight at [[their]2682-they own house]2684-their own house , but after that [Dodo]79-dodo had made arrangements apart from [him]80-chesterford . [She]79-dodo had to go and see [[her]79-dodo mother]2147-her mother , [she]79-dodo had to go here and there , and half way through September , when [Chesterford]80-chesterford had returned to [Harchester]19-harchester expecting [her]79-dodo the same night , [he]80-chesterford found a postcard from [her]79-dodo , saying [she]79-dodo had to spend three days with [someone else]715-someone else , and the three days lengthened into a week , and it was only yesterday that [Dodo]79-dodo had come and [people]308-people were arriving that very evening . There was only one conclusion to be drawn from all this , and not even [he]80-chesterford could help drawing it . [Jack]78-jack and [Mr. Spencer]154-mr. spencer and [Maud]81-maud , now [Mrs. Spencer]158-algy , arrived that evening . [Maud]81-maud had started a sort of small store of work , and the worsted and crochet went on with feverish rapidity . It had become a habit with [her]81-maud before [her]81-maud marriage , and the undeveloped possibilities , that no doubt lurked within it , had blossomed under [[her]81-maud husband]387-her husband 's care . For there was a demand beyond the limits of supply for [her]81-maud woollen shawls and comforters . [[Mr. Spencer]154-mr. spencer 's parish]2689-mr. spencer 's parish was already speckled with testimonies to [[his]154-mr. spencer wife]325-his wife 's handiwork , and [Maud]81-maud 's dream of being some day useful to [somebody]511-somebody was finding a glorious fulfilment . [Dodo]79-dodo , [I]0-i am sorry to say , found [[her]79-dodo sister]341-her sister more unsatisfactory than ever . [Maud]81-maud had a sort of confused idea that it helped the poor if [she]81-maud dressed untidily , and this was a ministry that came without effort . [Dodo]79-dodo took [her]81-maud in hand as soon as [she]81-maud arrived , and made [her]81-maud presentable . "[0-i] Because [you]1280-you are [[a clergy - man]1281-a clergy - man 's wife]1282-a clergy - man 's wife , there is no reason that [you]1280-you should n't wear a tucker or something round [your]1280-you neck , " said [she]81-maud . [The three]2125-the three had been [there]267-there several days , and [Dodo]79-dodo was getting impatient . [Jack]78-jack and [Chesterford]80-chesterford went out shooting , and [she]79-dodo was left to entertain [the other two]2695-the other two . [Mr. Spencer]154-mr. spencer 's reluctance to shoot was attributable not so much to [his]154-mr. spencer aversion to killing live animals , as [his]154-mr. spencer inability to slay . But when [Dodo]79-dodo urged on [him]154-mr. spencer that [he]154-mr. spencer would soon learn , [he]154-mr. spencer claimed the higher motive . [She]79-dodo was rather silent , for [she]79-dodo was thinking about something important . [Dodo]79-dodo was surprised at the eagerness with which [she]79-dodo looked forward to [Jack]78-jack 's coming . Somehow , in a dim kind of way , [she]79-dodo regarded [him]78-jack as the solution of [her]79-dodo difficulties . [She]79-dodo felt pretty certain [Jack]78-jack would do as [he]78-jack was asked , and [she]79-dodo had made up [her]79-dodo mind that when [Jack]78-jack went away [she]79-dodo would go with [him]78-jack to see friends at [other houses to which [he]78-jack was going]2696-other houses to which he was going . And [Chesterford]80-chesterford ? [Dodo]79-dodo 's scheme did not seem to take in [Chesterford]80-chesterford . [She]79-dodo had painted a charming little picture in [her]79-dodo own mind as to where [she]79-dodo should go , and whom [she]79-dodo would see , but [she]79-dodo certainly was aware that [Chesterford]80-chesterford did not seem to come in . It would spoil the composition , [she]79-dodo thought , to introduce [another figure]2697-another figure . That would be a respite , anyhow . But after that , what then ? [Dodo]79-dodo had found it bad enough coming back this September , and [she]79-dodo could not contemplate renewing this t√™te - √† - t√™te that went on for months . And by degrees another picture took its place ‚Äî a dim one , for the details were not worked out ‚Äî but in that picture there were only two figures . The days went on and [Dodo]79-dodo could bear it no longer . One evening [she]79-dodo went into [the smoking - room]443-the smoking - room after tea . [Chesterford]80-chesterford was writing letters , and [Maud]81-maud and [[her]81-maud husband]387-her husband were sitting in [the drawing - room]338-the drawing - room . " [Jack]78-jack did not need explanations . "[0-i] [Ah!"‚Äîthen]180-ah!"‚Äîthen after a moment , "[80-chesterford] poor [Chesterford]80-chesterford ! ' [He]80-chesterford was quite satisfied , anyhow , for some months , for a year in fact , more or less , and [I]0-i was never satisfied at all . " [Dodo]79-dodo sat with [her]79-dodo hands clasped before [her]79-dodo , with something like tears in [her]79-dodo eyes . " [Jack]78-jack felt intensely uncomfortable . "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't help [you]1290-you , [Dodo]79-dodo , " [he]0-i said . "[79-dodo] It is useless for [me]0-i to say [I]0-i am sincerely sorry . At last it came out with an effort . "[1290-you] [Jack]78-jack , do [you]78-jack still love [me]0-i ? " [Dodo]79-dodo did not look at [him]78-jack , but kept [her]79-dodo eyes on the fire . [Jack]78-jack did not pause to think . "[78-jack] Before [God]99-god , [Dodo]79-dodo , " , [he]0-i said , "[79-dodo] [I]0-i believe [I]0-i love [you]79-dodo more than anything in [the world]321-the world . " "[0-i] Will [you]79-dodo do what [I]0-i ask [you]79-dodo ? " This time [he]78-jack did pause . [He]78-jack got up and stood before the fire . Still [Dodo]79-dodo did not look at [him]78-jack . "[79-dodo] Ah , [Dodo]79-dodo , " [he]0-i said , "[79-dodo] what are [you]79-dodo going to ask ? There are some things [I]0-i can not do . " "[0-i] It seems to [me]0-i this love [you]79-dodo talk of is a very weak thing , " said [Dodo]79-dodo . "[79-dodo] It always fails , or is in danger of failing , at the critical point . [I]0-i believe [I]0-i could do anything for [the man [I]0-i loved]1292-the man i loved . [I]0-i did not think so once . But [I]0-i was wrong , as [I]0-i have been in [my]0-i marriage . " [Dodo]79-dodo paused ; but [Jack]78-jack said nothing ; it seemed to [him]78-jack as if [Dodo]79-dodo had not quite finished . "[0-i] Yes , " [she]79-dodo said ; then paused again . "[0-i] Yes , [you]79-dodo are [he]1292-the man i loved . " There was a dead silence . For one moment time seemed to [Jack]78-jack to have stopped , and [he]78-jack could have believed that that moment lasted for years ‚Äî for ever . "[79-dodo] Oh , [[my]0-i God]375-my god , " [he]0-i murmured , "[79-dodo] at last . " [He]0-i was conscious of [Dodo]79-dodo sitting there , with [her]79-dodo eyes raised to [his]0-i , and a smile on [her]79-dodo lips . [He]0-i felt [himself]0-i bending forward towards [her]79-dodo , and [he]0-i thought [she]79-dodo half rose in [her]79-dodo chair to receive [his]0-i embrace . But the next moment [she]79-dodo put out [her]79-dodo hand as if to stop [him]0-i . "[79-dodo] Stay , " [she]79-dodo said . "[0-i] Not yet , not yet . There is something first . [I]0-i will tell [you]0-i what [I]0-i have done . [I]0-i counted on this . [I]0-i have ordered [the carriage]992-the carriage after dinner at half - past ten . [You]0-i and [I]0-i go in that , and leave by [the train]1295-the train . [Jack]78-jack , [I]0-i am [yours]78-jack ‚Äî will [you]0-i come ? " [Dodo]79-dodo had taken the plunge . [She]79-dodo had been wavering on the brink of this for days . It had struck [her]79-dodo suddenly that afternoon that [Jack]78-jack was going away next day , and [she]79-dodo was aware [she]79-dodo could not contemplate the indefinite to - morrow and to - morrow without [him]78-jack . Like all [Dodo]79-dodo 's actions it came suddenly . The forces in [her]79-dodo which had been drawing [her]79-dodo on to this had gathered strength and sureness imperceptibly , and this evening [they]2701-they had suddenly burst through the very flimsy dam that [Dodo]79-dodo had erected between the things [she]79-dodo might do , and the things [she]79-dodo might not , and [their]2701-they possession was complete . In a way it was inevitable . [Dodo]79-dodo felt that [her]79-dodo life was impossible . [Chesterford]80-chesterford , with infinite yearning and hunger at [his]80-chesterford heart , perhaps felt it too . [Jack]78-jack felt as if [he]78-jack was waking out of some blissful dream to a return of [his]78-jack ordinary everyday life , which , unfortunately , had certain moral obligations attached to it . If [Dodo]79-dodo 's speech had been shorter , the result might have been different . [He]0-i steadied [himself]0-i for a moment , for [the room]339-the room seemed to reel and swim , and then [he]0-i answered [her]79-dodo . "[0-i] No , [Dodo]79-dodo , " [he]0-i said hoarsely , "[79-dodo] [I]0-i can not do it . Think of [Chesterford]80-chesterford ! Think of anything ! Do n't tempt [me]0-i . [You]80-chesterford know [I]0-i can not . How dare [you]80-chesterford ask [me]0-i ? " [Dodo]79-dodo 's face grew hard and white . [She]79-dodo tried to laugh , but could not manage it . "[80-chesterford] Ah , " [she]79-dodo said , "[80-chesterford] the old story , is n't it ? [[Potiphar]181-potiphar 's wife]1296-potiphar 's wife again . And now [I]0-i have debased and humbled [myself]0-i before [you]80-chesterford , and there [you]80-chesterford stand in [your]80-chesterford immaculate virtue , not caring ‚Äî " "[80-chesterford] Do n't , [Dodo]79-dodo , " [He]80-chesterford said . "[79-dodo] Be merciful to [me]0-i , spare [me]0-i . Not caring ‚Äî [you]79-dodo know it is not so . But [I]0-i can not do this . [[My]0-i [Dodo]79-dodo]1297-my dodo , [[my]0-i darling]429-my darling . " The strain was too great for [him]80-chesterford . [He]80-chesterford knelt down beside [her]79-dodo , and kissed [her]79-dodo hand passionately . "[79-dodo] [I]0-i will do anything for [you]79-dodo , " [he]80-chesterford whispered , "[0-i] that is in [my]0-i power to do ; but this is impossible . Do n't let [us]1300-us degrade it , let it be a strength to [us]1300-us and not a weakness . [You]79-dodo must feel it so . " There was a long silence , and in that silence the great drama of love and life ; and good and evil , which has been played every day of every year since the beginning of [this world]2207-this world , and which will never cease till [all mankind]2704-all mankind are [saints]2302-saints or sexless , filled the stage . [Dodo]79-dodo thought , at any rate , that [she]79-dodo loved [him]0-i , and that knowledge made [her]79-dodo feel less abased before [him]0-i . All love ‚Äî the love for [children]731-children , for [parents]2707-parents , for [husband]2708-husband , for [wife]2709-wife , for [lover]2710-lover , for [mistress]2711-mistress ‚Äî has something divine about it , or else it is not love . The love [Jack]78-jack felt for [her]79-dodo was divine enough not to seek its own , to sacrifice itself on the altar of duty and loyalty and the pure cold gods , and in its tumultuous happiness it could think of [others]299-others . And [Dodo]79-dodo 's love was touched , though ever so faintly , with the same divine spark , a something so human that it touched heaven . Now it had so happened that , exactly three minutes before this , [Maud]81-maud had found that [she]81-maud had left a particularly precious skein of wool in [another room]2713-another room . About ten seconds ' reflection made [her]81-maud remember [she]81-maud had left it in [the smoking - room]443-the smoking - room , where [she]81-maud had sat with [Dodo]79-dodo after lunch , who had smoked cigarettes , and lectured [her]81-maud on [her]81-maud appearance . [The smoking - room]443-the smoking - room had two doors , about eight yards apart , forming [a little passage lighted with a skylight]2716-a little passage lighted with a skylight . The first of those doors was of wood , the second , which led into [the smoking - room]443-the smoking - room , of baize . The first door was opened in the ordinary manner , the second with a silent push . [Maud]81-maud had made this silent push at the moment when [Jack]78-jack was kneeling by [Dodo]79-dodo 's side , kissing [her]79-dodo hand . [Maud]81-maud was not versed in the wickedness of [this present world]2718-this present world , but [she]81-maud realised that this was a peculiar thing for [Jack]78-jack to do , and [she]81-maud let the door swing quietly back , and ran [downstairs]2126-downstairs , intending to ask [[her]81-maud husband]387-her husband 's advice . [[Chesterford]80-chesterford 's study]2721-chesterford 's study opened into [the drawing - room]338-the drawing - room . During the time that [Maud]81-maud had been [upstairs]337-upstairs [he]387-her husband had gone in to fetch [Dodo]79-dodo , and seeing [she]79-dodo was not [there]267-there [he]387-her husband went back , but did not close the door behind [him]387-her husband . " [Algernon]158-algy was suitably horrified . [He]387-her husband remarked , with much reason , that it was no use telling [Dodo]79-dodo and [Jack]78-jack , because [they]343-anyone knew already . At this moment the door of [[Lord Chesterford]80-chesterford 's study]2728-lord chesterford 's study was closed quietly . [He]387-her husband did not wish to hear any more just yet . But [they]343-anyone neither of [them]343-anyone noticed it . [He]387-her husband had overheard something which was not meant for [his]387-her husband ears , related by [a person who had overseen what [she]2729-a person who had overseen what she was not meant to see was not meant to see]2729-a person who had overseen what she was not meant to see ; [he]387-her husband hated learning anything that was not [his]387-her husband own affair , but [he]387-her husband had learned it , and it turned out to be unpleasantly closely connected with [him]387-her husband . [His]387-her husband first impulse was to think that [Jack]78-jack had behaved in a treacherous and blackguardly manner , and this conclusion surprised [him]387-her husband so much that [he]387-her husband set to ponder over it . The more [he]387-her husband thought of it , the more unlikely it appeared to [him]387-her husband . [Jack]78-jack making love to [[his]78-jack wife]325-his wife under cover of [his]78-jack own roof was too preposterous an idea to be entertained . [He]387-her husband held a very high opinion of [Jack]78-jack , and it did not at all seem to fit in with this . Was there any other possibility ? It came upon [him]387-her husband with a sense of sickening probability that there was . [He]387-her husband remembered the long loveless months ; [he]387-her husband remembered [Dodo]79-dodo 's indifference to [him]387-her husband , then [her]79-dodo neglect , then [her]79-dodo dislike . Had [Jack]78-jack been hideously tempted and not been able to resist ? [Chesterford]80-chesterford almost felt a friendly feeling for not being able to resist [Dodo]79-dodo . What did all this imply ? How long had it been going on ? How did it begin ? Where would it stop ? [He]387-her husband felt [he]387-her husband had a right to ask these questions , and [he]387-her husband meant to ask them of [the proper person]2731-the proper person . But not yet . [He]387-her husband would wait ; [he]387-her husband would see what happened . [He]387-her husband was afraid of judging both too harshly . [Maud]81-maud 's account might have been incorrect ; anyhow it was not meant for [him]387-her husband . [His]387-her husband thoughts wandered on dismally and vaguely . But the outcome was , that [he]387-her husband said to [himself]387-her husband , "[79-dodo] [Poor Dodo]79-dodo , [God]99-god forgive [her]79-dodo . " [He]387-her husband had been so long used to the altered state of things that this blow seemed to [him]387-her husband only a natural sequence . But [he]387-her husband had been used to feed [his]387-her husband starved heart with promises that [Dodo]79-dodo would care for [him]387-her husband again ; that those months when [they]2732-they were first married were only the bud of a flower that would some day blossom . It was this feeble hope that what [he]387-her husband had heard destroyed . If things had gone as far as that it was hopeless . "[79-dodo] Yes , " [he]387-her husband repeated , "[79-dodo] it is all gone . " If anything could have killed [his]387-her husband love for [Dodo]79-dodo [he]387-her husband felt that it would have been this . But , as [he]387-her husband sat there , [he]387-her husband said to [himself]387-her husband , "[79-dodo] [She]79-dodo shall never know that [I]0-i know of it . " That was [his]387-her husband final determination . [Dodo]79-dodo had wronged [him]387-her husband cruelly ; [his]387-her husband only revenge was to continue as if [she]79-dodo had been [a faithful wife]2733-a faithful wife , for [she]79-dodo would not let [him]387-her husband love [her]79-dodo . [Dodo]79-dodo should never know , [she]79-dodo should not even suspect . [He]387-her husband would go on behaving to [her]79-dodo as before , as far as lay in [his]387-her husband power . [He]387-her husband would do [his]387-her husband utmost to make [her]79-dodo contented , to make [her]79-dodo less sorry ‚Äî yes , less sorry ‚Äî [she]79-dodo married [him]387-her husband . " [Jack]78-jack was really to be pitied more than [Dodo]79-dodo . The struggle itself was over . [He]78-jack felt like a chain being pulled in opposite directions . [He]78-jack did not wrestle any longer ; [the two forces]2735-the two forces , [he]78-jack thought , were simply fighting it out over [his]78-jack rigid body . But there is something more , something which it is hard for [me]0-i to say . " [He]0-i paused , and [Jack]78-jack noticed that [he]0-i was crumpling a piece of paper [he]0-i held in [his]0-i hand into a tight hard ball . "[79-dodo] Then ‚Äî then [Dodo]79-dodo is tired of [me]0-i ? " [Jack]78-jack felt helpless and sick . [He]78-jack could not trust [himself]78-jack to speak . "[79-dodo] Is n't it so ? " asked [Chesterford]80-chesterford again . [Jack]78-jack for reply held out both [his]78-jack hands without speaking . There was something horrible in the sight of [this strong man]2754-this strong man standing pale and trembling before [him]78-jack . In a moment [Chesterford]80-chesterford turned away , and stood warming [his]80-chesterford hands at the fire . "[0-i] [I]0-i heard something [I]0-i was n't meant to hear , " [he]80-chesterford said , "[0-i] and [I]0-i know as much as [I]0-i wish to . It does n't much matter exactly what has happened . [You]1338-you have told [me]0-i [you]1338-you are still [[my]0-i friend]1339-my friend , and [I]0-i thank [you]1338-you for it . And [Dodo]79-dodo ‚Äî [Dodo]79-dodo is tired of [me]0-i . [I]0-i can reconstruct as much as is necessary . [You]1338-you are going off to - morrow , are n't [you]1338-you ? [I]0-i sha'n't see [you]1338-you again . Good - bye , [Jack]78-jack ; try to forget [I]0-i ever mistrusted [you]78-jack . [I]0-i must ask [you]78-jack to leave [me]0-i ; [I]0-i 've got some things to think over . " But [Jack]78-jack still lingered . "[0-i] Try to forgive [Dodo]79-dodo , " [he]78-jack said ; "[79-dodo] and forgive [me]0-i for saying so , but do n't be hard on [her]79-dodo . It will only make things worse . " "[79-dodo] Hard on [her]79-dodo ? " asked [Chesterford]80-chesterford . "[79-dodo] [Poor Dodo]79-dodo , it is hard on [her]79-dodo enough without that . [She]79-dodo shall never know that [I]0-i know , if [I]0-i can help . [I]0-i am not going to tell [you]78-jack what [I]0-i know either . If [you]78-jack feel wronged that [I]0-i even asked [you]78-jack that question , [I]0-i am sorry for it , but [I]0-i had grounds , and [I]0-i am not [a jealous man]1340-a jealous man . The whole thing has been an awful mistake . [I]0-i knew it in [July]182-july , but [I]0-i shall not make it worse by telling [Dodo]79-dodo . " [Jack]78-jack went out from [his]78-jack presence with a kind of awe . [He]78-jack did not care to know how [Chesterford]80-chesterford had found out , or how much . All other feelings were swallowed up in a vast pity for [this poor man , whom no human aid could ever reach]2755-this poor man , whom no human aid could ever reach . The great fabric which [his]78-jack love had raised had been shattered hopelessly , and [his]78-jack love sat among its ruins and wept . It was all summed up in that short sentence , "[79-dodo] [Dodo]79-dodo is tired of [me]0-i , " and [Jack]78-jack knew that it was true . The whole business was hopeless . [Dodo]79-dodo had betrayed [him]78-jack , and [he]78-jack knew it . [He]78-jack could no longer find a cold comfort in the thought that some day , if the difficult places could be tided over , [she]79-dodo might grow to love [him]78-jack again . That was past . And yet [he]78-jack had only one thought , and that was for [Dodo]79-dodo . "[79-dodo] [She]79-dodo shall never know [I]0-i know it . " Truly there is something divine in [those men [we]2757-we thought most human]2756-those men we thought most human . [Jack]78-jack went to [[his]78-jack room]2284-his room and thought it all over . [He]78-jack was horribly vexed with [himself]78-jack for having exculpated [himself]78-jack , but the point of [Chesterford]80-chesterford 's question was quite clear , and there was only one answer to it . [Chesterford]80-chesterford obviously did mean to ask whether [he]78-jack had been guilty of the great act of disloyalty which [Dodo]79-dodo had proposed , and on the whole [he]80-chesterford would reconstruct the story in [his]80-chesterford mind more faithfully than if [he]78-jack had answered anything else , or had refused to answer . But [Jack]78-jack very much doubted whether [Chesterford]80-chesterford would reconstruct the story at all . The details had evidently no interest for [him]78-jack . All that mattered was expressed in that one sentence , "[79-dodo] [Dodo]79-dodo is tired of [me]0-i . " [Jack]78-jack would have given [his]78-jack right hand to have been able to answer "[79-dodo] No , " or to have been able to warn [Dodo]79-dodo ; but [he]78-jack saw that there was nothing to be done . The smash had come , [Chesterford]80-chesterford had had a rude awakening . But [his]80-chesterford love was not dead , though it was stoned and beaten and outcast . With this in mind [Jack]78-jack took a sheet of paper from [his]78-jack writing - case , and wrote on it these words : ‚Äî "[79-dodo] Do not desecrate it ; let it help [you]1341-you to make an effort .
